review_blob: As far as imported beers go, this one holds up pretty well.  It actually has a slightly malty taste, isn't skunky tasting, and is pretty refreshing.  The kind of beer you could throw in a tub of ice and drink all afternoon when it is really really hot out- sort of like in Africa.  A good, solid import.

Probably one of the better really cheap beers you can get, in my opinion.  But unlike most cheap beers, it is actually made with real malt, which gives it a slightly smooth, drinkable taste. Dont recommend drinking it from the can as it gets that tinny taste pretty easily- bottle or tap is better.

This beer looks pretty good and all... but I bought it thinking it would have some semblance of blueberry in it.  The blueberry touches were so subtle I sort of forgot they were there and thought I was just drinking a decent wheat beer.  Dont get me wrong, I dont like the sweet fruity beers at all, I just wished there was a little more to this one.
beer_name: Sea Dog Wild Blueberry Wheat Ale

review_blob: The aroma and palate dont do the greatness of this beer justice.  This is an incredible example of the stlye... perfect for any really cold/snowy day.

I really enjoy a good fruit beer now and again, and felt this was one of the better I have had.  The blueberry aroma is fairly evident, but the subtle blueberry taste (evident but not overwhelming) makes this a very drinkable and refreshing fruit beer.
